g.text: Build a RESTful API for customer management with CRUD operations, email validation, and audit logging.
Focus on scalability and maintainability for enterprise use.
• Customer CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
• Email address validation and uniqueness constraints
• Comprehensive audit trail for all customer changes
• RESTful API design with proper HTTP status codes and error handling
• Data pagination for efficient list operations
• ASP.NET Core 8.0 with Entity Framework Core and SQL Server
• JWT authentication, support for 1000+ concurrent users, sub-200ms response times
• OpenAPI/Swagger documentation, comprehensive unit test coverage
AI Agent: Context analysis complete. CustomerController generated with validation.
Context Engine: Architecture validation passed. Ready for implementation review.
I've analyzed your context and generated the CustomerController with
comprehensive validation, audit logging, and proper error handling.
Great! Can you add optimistic concurrency control for updates?
Excellent suggestion! I've added optimistic concurrency control:
• Proper 409 Conflict responses for concurrent updates
Perfect! Now generate comprehensive unit tests for the concurrency
scenarios. Include both success and conflict cases.
I've generated comprehensive concurrency tests including:
• Integration tests with actual database operations
All tests follow AAA pattern with clear naming conventions.
Excellent! Can you also generate API documentation?
I've generated comprehensive OpenAPI documentation with:
Great work! Now let's discuss deployment strategies.
What would you recommend for Azure deployment?
• Azure App Service for the API with auto-scaling
• Application Insights for monitoring and diagnostics
I can generate the deployment scripts and ARM templates.
Ask about architecture decisions or request changes...
